```{r}

```

```{r}
sapply(lapply(df, unique), length)
```

```{r}
#Deleting those columns
df = subset(df, select = -c(X, out))
```


```{r}
#Absolute full model
fullmodel <- lm(price ~ ., data = df)
summary(fullmodel)
```


```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(fullmodel)
```



```{r}
#Log transformation - full model
logged_fullmodel <- lm(log(price) ~ ., data = df)
summary(logged_fullmodel)
```


```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(logged_fullmodel)
```

```{r}
#Determining by AIC
library(leaps)
library(MASS)

n = dim(df)[1]; 
reg1 = regsubsets(log(price) ~ ., data = df)
rs = summary(reg1)
rs$which
```

```{r}
AIC = 2*(2:23) + n*log(rs$rss / n)
plot(AIC ~ I(1:22), xlab = "Number of Predictors", ylab = "AIC")
```




```{r}
BIC = log(n)*(2:23) + n*log(rs$rss/n) 
plot(BIC ~ I(1:22), xlab = "number of predictors", ylab = "BIC")
```

```{r}
r = resid(mfg)
n = dim(df)[1]; 
x = head(df$r, n-1)
y = tail(df$r, n-1)
```


```{r}
x
```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)
srp = data.frame(x,y)
ggplot(srp, aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
    geom_point() + 
    geom_vline(xintercept = 0) + 
    geom_hline(yintercept = 0) + 
    xlab(expression(hat(epsilon)[i])) +
    ylab(expression(hat(epsilon)[i+1])) + 
    ggtitle("Successive Residual Plot") + 
    theme_bw() + 
    theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
```



```{R}
rfe1 <- lm(price ~ CompanyName + fueltype + wheelbase + curbweight + enginetype + 
                 cylindernumber + stroke + horsepower + citympg + highwaympg, data = df)
summary(rfe1)
```


```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(rfe1)
```

```{R}
logged_rfe1 <- lm(log(price) ~ CompanyName + fueltype + wheelbase + curbweight + enginetype + 
                 cylindernumber + stroke + horsepower + citympg + highwaympg, data = df)
summary(logged_rfe1)
```

```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(logged_rfe1)
```

```{R}
rfe2 <- update(df_model1, .~. -highwaympg)
summary(rfe2)
```

```{R}
rfe3 <- update(df_model2, .~. -citympg)
summary(rfe3)
```

```{R}
rfe4 <- update(df_model3, .~. -wheelbase)
summary(rfe4)
```

```{R}
logged_rfe4 <- lm(log(price) ~ CompanyName + fueltype + curbweight + enginetype + 
                 cylindernumber + stroke + horsepower, data = df)
summary(logged_rfe4)
```

```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(logged_rfe4)
```


```{R}
anova(rfe4, rfe1)
```

The result shows a non-significant result (p = 0.08309). Thus, we should reject df_model1 and stick with df_model4.
```{R}
anova(logged_rfe4, logged_rfe1)
```
As the p-value is less than 0.05, we can say that logged_df_1 is enough and we don't need reduced model i.e. logged_df_4.

```{r}
anova(mfg, logged_rfe1)
```
